column4: so the list in synaptic is a list of packages that aren't upgraded...?
where can I find packages that are available to be added through apt-get
or are all of those the ones that can be upgraded?
(i have the warty live CD)
:P
i'm a big fan of "the best linux distro is the one that you like the best..."
so, i'm trying a few out
i run slackware -current, which is updated once or twice a week
and apt-get is pretty stable?  i've used a few auto-updaters that can bork some deps pretty bad
apt-get is awesome
you type apt-get update (updates the package list) then apt-get upgrade (downloads and installs all updates)
and that is pretty reliable and efficient?
I bet all of your systems will be running Ubuntu within 2 weeks :)
I would check out www.ubuntuguide.org it answers all the basic questions about using Ubuntu for new users.
well, yeah...i just wanted a few specific questiosn answered, seeing as how i'm not really a linux newb
I wasn't trying to insult your intelligence or anything, but there is alot of good info on there with regards to how Ubuntu does things
yes
you can always take the initiative and package the latest gaim and submit it for inclusion in Ubuntu :)
the devs think it's too buggy for inclusion
yes
